comment: It was a tough class but he's  a cool guy. All of his lectures are powerpoint based from the book. 3 tests including the final and some online quizzes and homework, which can be annoying but I've dealt with worse. Also he allows you to use a cheat sheet for all tests and the final and allows for test corrections.

I actually took him for Business Negotiation and Professor Mendelson was an amazing instructor.  He has vast knowledge of the law and gives real world, interesting material.  He is a huge asset to KSU, but is going to another school and will be missed.  Any student who took his class was truly blessed.

I had to retake this class and I love this teacher. He explains things and even gives you previous exams as study guides for his test. Also you can do test corrections. He is funny and makes this class interesting and easy to learn. I will say I got an A in this class so fair which is far better than my last course I took.

I enjoyed his class.  Had him back to back for 2 classes. If you came to class you knew what was going on and knew if you did the work you would do ok.  If you skipped class it was obvious.  I felt he was fair and entertaining and taking ACCT 3100 now I was well prepared to do well in this class. Wish he taught more classes.

Mendelson is no Mendelssohn, but he is definitely a Romantic thinker.   I don't mean it the way that you are interpreting it  He is very idealistic, especially for his age   He makes great jokes and explains the content in a way that most people can understand.
Mendelson is by far my favorite professor at Kennesaw.  He is an intelligent man, quite cute for a middle-aged man from Florida, and is fun to talk to.

An excellent professor, perhaps one of the most handsome men in the school. He is a real bad boy! I never thought I would fine accounting so... interesting. He has a way with words that no one can match and he is a real charmer.

Funny fella, good-hearted, but the ACCT2100 course itself is a difficult one to teach. Despite the course, he proved fairly organized, but also made several mistakes. Class lets out early all the time though which is a plus for me as I learn better on my own. Textbook is necessary in order to do the work, so be prepared to throw some cash away

Professor Mendelson was very funny, at times confusing but overall an easy class. Only one final take home test. We had to read cases from Harvard Law and discuss them in class every week. Very entertaining. No homework or group project. The only downside was I did not get my grade until the end of finals week.

Prof. Mendelson was nice, but not very organized. "3" Grades all semester, but were not posted into D2L. He does give you a chance to revise your test for a better grade. Also, he allowed a note card note card on the test. However, no syllabus was available. There was a guideline that he verbally gave us for the class though. Received a B overall.

Prof. Mendelson was not very organized - his lectures were 2 hours of him reading the PowerPoints and telling irrelevant stories. His class did nothing to prepare me for the tests. I was disappointed in the job he did. Would not take again.
Not an organized professor. We didn't receive a syllabus or a grade all semester, only a final grade at the end. Don't take him!

Lets class out early but doesn't go over enough practice in class, and whatever practice is done is hard to understand and often done incorrectly. Gave  "practice tests" which were nothing like the actual tests, which were extremely difficult.  Unhelpful in emails and class. Very confusing. Don't take unless you can teach yourself accounting.

Professor Mendelson is unorganized and does the problems wrong 70% of the time. He reads directly off the PP and doesn't explain anything in depth. If you want to learn do not take him; however, if you want an easy C take him. If you want an A you will have to teach yourself the material. YOU CAN NOT FAIL his class, too many opportunities to dowell

I took Professor Mendelson's Saturday class. He lets you out early and canceled class twice. He reads straight off the power-points. Connect assignments are mandatory each week but he opens them back up towards the end of the semester.  Class material is hard but he lets you do test corrections. Not the best teacher but he will work with you.

I wouldn't take him again. I took his class during summer, and I regret it. One test and one paper, but you won't see what you got wrong after. Scattered thoughts; tries to make jokes and fun, but the lectures seem to drag.

This class is a joke.  He is the worst professor that I have ever had.  He doesn't answer emails and his syllabus is unclear.  He does allow for an easy A but that is not teaching.  If you are into learning on your own, by all means, take his class but I pay out of my pocket for my education therefore, I want to get my money's worth.

Does not teach material, just reads slided. Nice guy but you have to teach yourself everything. Does help boost your grade by re-doing exams for 1/2 a point and is flexible with h.w. So, you will definately pass the class but won't know the materials.

Yeah he was all over the place like previous people say but this is the EASIEST class i have ever taken. i am horrible at acct but he gives you so many opportunities for an A, test corrections (helps a lot), extra credit points, opens hw again, and even though it was dreadful to go to school on a saturday DO IT! It is so worth it. Ends class early
Do not take him for ACCT 2200. He Doesnt Know the Material So its a Self Taught Class

Great quality teacher. I took his ACCT 1 course as a night class at 9:30 and he always added enough energy and levity to the classroom to keep us on our toes. Would definitely take again if given the chance.
I simply didn't like his  teaching style. It was all over the place. Cant take him serious as a professor.
AWESOME TEACHER!! VERY FUNNY MAN!! GREAT COURSE!! I really feel like I learned the information.

Prof Mendelson is awesome. His class is really interesting believe it or not. He's a little scatter-brained, but his tangents are not only funny, but relative to the material. I didn't need the book, but it helps to have. I HIGHLY recommend any of his courses.
His grading policy is more then fare. Homework is online and can be done over as many times as you like. Tests are also online and relatively easy if you pay attention.
